head.title: Treasury to Auction Only Bills This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury to Auction Only Bills This Week

block.p: LEAD: Treasury financings this week are confined to the regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills today. By late Friday, the rate for the three-month bill was 7.39 percent, and the rate was 7.34 percent for the six-month bill.

LEAD: Treasury financings this week are confined to the regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills today. By late Friday, the rate for the three-month bill was 7.39 percent, and the rate was 7.34 percent for the six-month bill.
The following new fixed-income issues are scheduled this week:
TAXABLE
TUESDAY
Chase Manhattan Corp., $200 million in subordinated auction-rate notes, due in 1999, BBB-/Baa-3/BBB+.
Western Massachusetts Electric, about $35 million in first-mortgage bonds (maturity to be announced), BBB/Baa-1/BBB+. Competitive.
Source: McCarthy, Crisanti & Maffei Inc.
Ratings: MCM/Moody's/Standard & Poor's.
TAX-EXEMPT
TUESDAY
Charlotte, N.C., $81.2 million in general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Houston, $75 million in revenue bonds. Competitive.
Los Angeles Department of Water and Power, $100 million in revenue bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY
Louisiana, $198.9 million in general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TENTATIVE OFFERINGS THIS WEEK
Chicago O'Hare International Airport, $235 million in debt securities. Merrill Lynch Capital Markets.
Connecticut Housing Finance Agency, $255.3 million in single-family mortgage revenue bonds. Paine Webber Inc.
Illinois Housing Development Agency, $100 million in single-family mortgage revenue bonds. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Indiana Housing Finance Agency, $100 million in single-family mortgage revenue bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
New York City, $750 million in general obligation bonds. Bear, Stearns.
New York State Mortgage Agency, $140 million in homeowner mortgage bonds. Goldman, Sachs.
Ohio Housing Finance Agency, $85 million in revenue bonds. Merrill Lynch Capital Markets.
Wisconsin Housing Economic Development Authority, $75 million in debt securities. Lehman Brothers.
